claim: Flublok ensures identical antigenic match with WHO- and FDA-selected flu strains.
explanation: Figure shows a schematic of Kaiser Permanente Northern California (KPNC) health care facilities of various sizes, allocation of similarly sized facilities into two blocks (A and B), and a table displaying weekly alternation of two vaccine formulations (SD-IIV4 and RIV4) across facilities for four weeks. does not support the claim because the figure describes randomization of facilities and weekly alternation between standard-dose inactivated vaccine (SD-IIV4) and recombinant quadrivalent influenza vaccine (RIV4), and contains no data on Flublok or antigenic match with WHO/FDA-selected strains.

detailed_analysis.image_description: Figure shows a schematic of Kaiser Permanente Northern California (KPNC) health care facilities of various sizes, allocation of similarly sized facilities into two blocks (A and B), and a table displaying weekly alternation of two vaccine formulations (SD-IIV4 and RIV4) across facilities for four weeks.
detailed_analysis.reasoning: does not support the claim because the figure describes randomization of facilities and weekly alternation between standard-dose inactivated vaccine (SD-IIV4) and recombinant quadrivalent influenza vaccine (RIV4), and contains no data on Flublok or antigenic match with WHO/FDA-selected strains.
